intro: Verticordia dichroma var. dichroma, commonly known as the blackleaf squill, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its striking, dark purple to black leaves and its clusters of small, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
